> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23038?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [ce1f81f...b9cae7e](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23038?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
Let me know if this is correct.

The neighboring sections are a bit strange, but "Package Overview" seems
like the right place.

Maybe we could expand the new section a bit with text describing the
modules that are public?

On Fri, Oct 26, 2018 at 3:38 AM Joris Van den Bossche <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@jorisvandenbossche* commented on this pull request.
>
> I think the text around it suggested by Tom in #23038 (comment)
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23038#discussion_r223694209>
> would still be good to add
>
> Do we have a better place for this than overview.rst ? It now feels a bit
> out of place between "Institutional partners" and "License"
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23038#pullrequestreview-168722317>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABQHIlw25ytIpc1-gQGdbfbdnNYChqjxks5uosoPgaJpZM4XMZ1w>
> .
>
Adding public modules to this would be a good idea.

I'm unsure about this. I see the value in documenting what is private or public, but:
- I agree that between partners and license doesn't seem to be the right place
- `api.rst` is already the list of what is public, and it's huge, we probably don't want to repeat this here, and I find quite confusing to have a public modules list with a subset

@TomAugspurger  What about moving this as a short `.. note::` section at the beginning of `api.rst` to warn about what is private instead?

I notice now that we *do* have a note like that at the top of api.rst:
http://pandas-docs.github.io/pandas-docs-travis/api.html

On Tue, Nov 20, 2018 at 8:58 AM Marc Garcia <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

>    - api.rst is already the list of what is public, and it's huge, we

That's funny, didn't see that. Closing this then, feel free to reopen if you think something else is needed.

Sorry for missing that @aparimeet. Let me know if you want help starting on
a new issue.
